entries.title: William Blake: An Annotated Bibliography
entries.content: This bibliography serves as a comprehensive resource for scholars, students, and enthusiasts of William Blake. The following pages contain a carefully curated collection of bibliographic entries spanning Blake's works, critical responses, and scholarly analyses.

entries.title: How to Use This Bibliography
entries.content: The bibliography is organized into ten main parts, each focusing on a different aspect of Blake studies. You can navigate through these sections using the sidebar menu, or search for specific entries using the search function. Each entry provides bibliographic information and a brief description of the content.

entries.title: Blake Scholarship Organization
entries.content: This bibliography arranges Blake scholarship into clear categories for easy reference. From teaching resources and general introductions to specialized studies of Blake's specific works, the categories reflect the breadth of Blake scholarship available today.

entries.title: Teaching Blake: Digital Resources and Archives
entries.content: An overview of digital resources available for teaching Blake's works in undergraduate and graduate courses, with special emphasis on the William Blake Archive and other online repositories.

entries.title: Annotating Blake: A Guide for Student Research
entries.content: A practical guide for instructors teaching students how to annotate Blake's illuminated works, with strategies for addressing the interplay between text and image.

entries.title: Blake Journals: A Comparative Analysis
entries.content: An examination of the various academic journals dedicated to Blake studies, including their focus areas, submission guidelines, and impact in the field.

entries.title: William Blake: A Comprehensive Introduction
entries.content: A thorough introduction to Blake's life, works, and cultural context, suitable for students and scholars new to Blake studies.
entries.chapter: PART II. GENERAL INTRODUCTIONS, HANDBOOKS, GLOSSARIES, AND CLASSIC STUDIES

entries.title: The Blake Handbook: Symbols, Techniques, and Themes
entries.content: A reference handbook covering Blake's symbolic system, artistic techniques, and recurring themes across his corpus of work.
entries.chapter: PART II. GENERAL INTRODUCTIONS, HANDBOOKS, GLOSSARIES, AND CLASSIC STUDIES

entries.title: Blake's Mythological Dictionary
entries.content: A glossary of Blake's personal mythology, providing definitions and contexts for the characters, places, and concepts that appear throughout his prophetic works.
entries.chapter: PART II. GENERAL INTRODUCTIONS, HANDBOOKS, GLOSSARIES, AND CLASSIC STUDIES

entries.title: William Blake: Poet and Painter
entries.content: A seminal study of Blake's integration of poetry and visual art, presenting an influential framework for understanding Blake's symbolic system.
entries.chapter: PART II. GENERAL INTRODUCTIONS, HANDBOOKS, GLOSSARIES, AND CLASSIC STUDIES

entries.title: The Complete Poetry and Prose of William Blake
entries.content: The standard scholarly edition of Blake's complete written works, featuring authoritative text and extensive annotations.
entries.chapter: PART III. EDITIONS OF BLAKE'S WRITING

entries.title: William Blake: The Complete Illuminated Books
entries.content: A collection of high-quality reproductions of Blake's illuminated books, accompanied by scholarly commentary and context.
entries.chapter: PART III. EDITIONS OF BLAKE'S WRITING

entries.title: William Blake: The Critical Heritage
entries.content: Comprehensive collection of contemporary responses to Blake's work from 1757 to 1863, including reviews, letters, and biographical accounts.

entries.title: Blake Books
entries.content: Detailed bibliographical descriptions of Blake's writings with information about their production, printing, and contemporary reception.

entries.title: Blake Books Supplement
entries.content: Supplementary volume to Blake Books with new information and corrections to the original bibliography.

entries.title: The Life of William Blake
entries.content: The first full-length biography of Blake, which helped revive interest in his work. Includes accounts from Blake's friends and contemporaries.

entries.title: William Blake: His Life and Work
entries.content: A biographical study that places Blake's work in the context of the revolutionary politics of his time.

entries.title: Catalogue of William Blake's Drawings and Paintings in the Huntington Library
entries.content: A detailed catalogue of the Blake collection at the Huntington Library, with high-quality reproductions and scholarly descriptions of each item.

entries.title: William Blake's Commercial Book Illustrations
entries.content: A catalogue raisonn√© of Blake's work as a commercial illustrator, documenting his contributions to books by other authors.

entries.title: Blake and the Bible
entries.content: A study of Blake's engagement with biblical texts and traditions, exploring how he reinterpreted religious imagery in his art and poetry.
entries.chapter: PART VII. STUDIES OF BLAKE ARRANGED BY SUBJECT

entries.title: Blake and Revolution
entries.content: An analysis of Blake's political thought and its relationship to the revolutionary movements of his time, with emphasis on his radical vision of social transformation.
entries.chapter: PART VII. STUDIES OF BLAKE ARRANGED BY SUBJECT

entries.title: William Blake's Songs of Innocence and of Experience: A Critical Edition
entries.content: A scholarly edition of Blake's most accessible work, featuring detailed commentary on each poem and plate.
entries.chapter: PART VIII. SPECIFIC WORKS BY BLAKE
entries.subheading: Songs of Innocence and of Experience

entries.title: The Marriage of Heaven and Hell: A Critical Study
entries.content: An in-depth analysis of Blake's provocative prose work, examining its philosophical ideas, artistic techniques, and cultural contexts.
entries.chapter: PART VIII. SPECIFIC WORKS BY BLAKE
entries.subheading: The Marriage of Heaven and Hell

entries.title: William Blake: Essays for S. Foster Damon
entries.content: A collection of scholarly essays on various aspects of Blake's work, published in honor of pioneering Blake scholar S. Foster Damon.
entries.chapter: PART IX. COLLECTIONS OF ESSAYS ON BLAKE PUBLISHED

entries.title: Blake, Modernity and Popular Culture
entries.content: An interdisciplinary collection exploring Blake's influence on modern literature, art, music, and popular culture.
entries.chapter: PART IX. COLLECTIONS OF ESSAYS ON BLAKE PUBLISHED

entries.title: William Blake's Circle: A Biographical Dictionary
entries.content: A reference work providing biographical information on Blake's contemporaries, patrons, and associates.

entries.title: Blake in the Marketplace, 1990-2014
entries.content: A chronicle of sales, exhibitions, and other market activities involving Blake's works, with analysis of trends in collecting and valuation.

PART VIII. SPECIFIC WORKS BY BLAKE: Songs of Innocence and of Experience
The Marriage of Heaven and Hell
